DataElement.preferredName: Patient Cardiovascular Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response that indicates a patient has a cardiovascular disorder that meets the eligibility criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Cardiovascular Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Cardiovascular Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have unstable an
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unstable angina, myocardial infarction or New York Heart Association (NYHA) class III/IV congestive heart failure within 30 days preceding study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have NYHA classification III or IV or history of myocardial infarction within 6 months of randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled angina, Canadian Cardiovascular Society grade II-IV despite medical support/management?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history or evidence of cardiovascular risk?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any of the following within 6 months prior to starting treatment, acute myocardial infarction, unstable angina, New York Heart Association functional classification of III or IV, left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) less than lower limit of normal (LLN) per institutional guidelines, or less than 55%, prior allogeneic bone marrow transplant or double umbilical cord blood transplantation, active hepatitis (B or C), active pneumonitis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unstable angina pectoris, congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association (NYHA) greater than or equal to Grade II, acute myocardial infarction, stroke or transient ischemic currently or within the last 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an adverse cardiac history (unstable angina, myocardial infarction less than 4 months, New York Heart Association [NYHA] class III or IV congestive heart failure [CHF], ejection fraction [EF] less than 40%, uncontrolled arrhythmias)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unstable angina, congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association [NYHA] Class III or IV, myocardial infarction (MI) within 6 months prior to first dose or clinically significant arrhythmia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unstable angina, congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association [NYHA] Class III or IV), myocardial infarction (MI) within 6 months prior to first dose, symptomatic cardiomyopathy or clinically significant arrhythmia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unstable angina?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -  11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known cardiopulmonary disease defined as: unstable angina, congestive heart failure (NYHA) class III or IV, myocardial infarction (MI) within 6 months prior to first dose, cardiomyopathy, and symptomatic pulmonary hypertension?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unstable angina pectoris?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known cardiopulmonary disease defined as: unstable angina, congestive heart failure (NYHA) class III or IV, myocardial infarction (MI) within 6 months prior to first dose, symptomatic cardiomyopathy, and symptomatic pulmonary hypertension?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have other cardiovascular-related abnormalities or therapy that prohibits participation, including myocardial infarction less than 6 months before start of study medications, unstable angina (angina symptoms at rest), new onset angina (begun within the last 3 months), uncontrolled arterial hypertension despite optimal medical management or anti-arrhythmic therapy (exceptions: beta blockers or digoxin are permitted)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known significant cardiopulmonary disease defined as: unstable angina; congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association [NYHA] Class III or IV); or myocardial infarction (MI) within 6 months prior to first dose?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of cerebrovascular (CVA), myocardial infarction, symptomatic congestive heart failure, cardiac arrhythmia, or unstable angina within the previous 6 months prior to starting therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a myocardial infarction within 6 months of study day 1, symptomatic congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association (NYHA) class III and higher), unstable angina, or cardiac arrhythmia requiring medication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have significant cardiopulmonary disease defined as: Acute myocardial infarction within the last 6 months, Unstable angina or Congestive heart failure NYHA Class III-IV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the atezolizumab + bevacizumab combination arm, does patient have congestive heart failure, baseline LVEF less than 50%, transmural myocardial infarction, uncontrolled hypertension (defined as systolic blood pressure greater than 140 mmHg and/or diastolic blood pressure greater than 90 mmHg in patients greater than or equal to 18 years of age), angina pectoris requiring medication, clinically significant valvular disease, high-risk arrhythmia within 12 months of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have New York Heart Association classification III/IV, advanced cardiac amyloidosis, or Mayo stage IIIB based on European Modification of the 2004 Standard Mayo Clinic Staging in patients with advanced cardiac involvement with NT-Pro BNP greater than 8500 pg/mL (Wechalekar et al., 2013)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled congestive heart failure (NYHA III, IV)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known cardiopulmonary disease defined as: unstable angina pectoris, congestive heart failure (NYHA) class III or IV, myocardial infarction (MI) within 6 months prior to first dose or cardiomyopathy?
